pageContext.description:
After the death of Friedrich III the Wise in 1525 his brother and successor Johann the Steadfast commissioned a series of portraits of the deceased, which were executed in the Cranach workshop by various employees. These small format portraits depict Friedrich III as a half-length figure, wearing a brown fur cloak and a white shirt with a dark beret on his head. Later this type was used again, frequently as a companion piece to portraits of Elector Johann who by that time had also died.  
[Lempertz online database: https://www.lempertz.com/de/kataloge/lot/920-1/1025-lucas-cranach-d-ae-werkstatt.html; accessed 27-03-2019]

pageContext.inscription:
Inscription at upper right: 'Friderich der Drit / Churfürst und Herzog zu Sachssen.'
[Lempertz online database: https://www.lempertz.com/de/kataloge/lot/920-1/1025-lucas-cranach-d-ae-werkstatt.html; accessed 27-03-2019]
